subject: RE: [junit] How do I implement a test case for a thrown exception?
msgSnippet: The test method below has three possible out comes: 1.  The tested exception is thrown and the test succeeds. 2.  The test fails without throwing an exception.
messageBody:
The test method below has three possible out comes:

1. The tested exception is thrown and the test succeeds.
2. The test fails without throwing an exception.
3. The test fails by throwing an exception different from the
exception being tested (and the name of the unexpected
exception is in the fail message).

try {
//tested code starts here.
...

fail( "should have thrown exception TestedException" )
} catch ( TestedException ) { return }
} catch ( Exception e ) { fail( "thrown wrong exception: "+e ); }
